title: Pigeonwing Dance's Carpet Series
description: Gabrielle Lamb’s Pigeonwing Dance presents outdoor performances that unfold on an 8×10 Persian carpet in parks and sidewalks across NYC.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Black Panther: Wakanda Forever at Brownsville Playground (Brownsville).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Bram Stoker's Dracula
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Bram Stoker's Dracula at Brooklyn Bridge Park's Harbor View Lawn.
address: Brooklyn Bridge Park, Harbor View Lawn

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Elemental
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Elemental at Harlem River Park.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Encanto
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Encanto at 145th and the Hudson River (Riverside Park).
address: 145th and the Hudson River, Riverside Park

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Past Lives
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Past Lives at Fort Greene Park.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: The Devil's Climb
description: Free outdoor movie screening of The Devil's Climb at Central Park (landscape between Sheep Meadow + the 72nd Street cross drive).

title: MetroCard Mosaic Workshop
description: Turn used Metrocards into art at a hands-on workshop led by mosaic artist Nina Boesch at the New York Transit Museum (Downtown Brooklyn). All skill levels welcome.
address: New York Transit Museum, Downtown Brooklyn

title: Live at the Archway: Music + Art in the Dumbo Archway
description: Sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the Manhattan Bridge in Dumbo. Tonight: NYC Queer Music Festival presents Janae Saisquoi, Noe Saenz, Keelin, Jackfruit, Emergency Tiara, Bell Bastien/OneUpDou, and Sunshyne + The Fox, with art by Melanie Hope Greenberg. Doors at 5pm. Rain or shine.
address: Dumbo Archway, under the Manhattan Bridge

title: ¡Arriba! Dance Party on the High Line
description: A section of the High Line turns into an open-air dance floor for the elevated park’s annual salsa party series. Tonight: salsa lessons followed by DJ sets by Mickey Pérez and a live performance by Los Hacheros. On the High Line between 15th + 16th streets (enter at 14th street).

title: SummerStage: Serpentwithfeet
description: NYC’s iconic summer performing arts festival returns with 85 free and benefit shows in Central Park and 12 neighborhood parks across the five boroughs. Tonight: Serpentwithfeet ‘Heart of Brick,’ Boy Cordero DJ, The Missing Element + Beatbox House at Marcus Garvey Park (East Harlem).

title: Facts Machine: Science, Comedy + Trivia
description: Scientists and comedians share the stories behind their favorite facts, ‘conduct experiments’ (play drinking games), and test their knowledge with a trivia challenge loosely inspired by the show’s theme, ‘Starry Not Sorry: Astrophysics.’ Hosted by scientists and pub trivia hosts Em Costa, Noah Guiberson, and Rob Frawley.

title: The Queens Jazz Trail Concert Series
description: Inspired by the Queens Jazz Trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, an evening performance series presents five free jazz concerts in Queens parks. Tonight: Sam Martinelli + The Brazilian Jazz Collective at Rockaway Beach.

title: Bookstore Romance Day: Romantasy Panel
description: Strand Bookstore celebrates Bookstore Romance Day with a panel discussion featuring romance authors Rebecca Kenney, Kate Dramis, Olivia Wildenstein, Hayley Dennings, Gloria Duke, and Xio Axelrod.

title: Entirely from Memory: Magic Mike
description: Blindly-cast Ten Bones Theatre Company performers will attempt to recreate 2012’s Magic Mike, using only what they can remember from watching the film once recently. As chaos ensues, drinks are drunk while the players are challenged to incorporate lines written by the audience and create ‘deleted’ scenes.

title: Locrian Chamber Players: An Evening of New Music
description: The Locrian Chamber Players, a chamber group devoted exclusively to music less than a decade old, present a concert of new works by Augusta Read Thomas, Oliver Knusson, Jeremy Beck, and others at Riverside Church (Morningside Heights).

title: Celebrity Memoir Book Club: Live
description: Celebrity Memoir Book Club podcast hosts Claire Parker and Ashley Hamilton are getting ready to take their live show to Australia. Join them as they test out segments and games with a New York audience.

title: Planet Yes: Beach Goth
description: Embrace the dark side of summer at House of Yes’s Beach Goth party.
cost: Free before midnight with RSVP, $10-15 otherwise.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Finding Nemo
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Finding Nemo at Carl Schurz Park (Yorkville).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Five Nights at Freddy's
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Five Nights at Freddy's at Stanley Isaacs Playground (UES).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Mamma Mia!
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Mamma Mia! at Pier A Park (Hoboken).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: OceanXplorers
description: Free outdoor movie screening of OceanXplorers at Central Park (landscape between Sheep Meadow + the 72nd Street cross drive).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Summer of Soul
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Summer of Soul at Valentino Pier Park (Red Hook).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: The Big Sleep
description: Free outdoor movie screening of The Big Sleep at Pier I in Riverside Park South (UWS).
address: Pier I, Riverside Park South, UWS

title: Free Outdoor Movies: The Little Mermaid (2023)
description: Free outdoor movie screening of The Little Mermaid (2023) at McCarren Park (Williamsburg).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Three Promises
description: Free outdoor movie screening of Three Promises at Brooklyn Commons Park (Downtown Brooklyn).

title: Fantastic Fiction
description: The speculative-fiction reading series at KGB Bar (East Village), hosted by editor Ellen Datlow and writer Matthew Kressel, welcomes authors Christopher Rowe (The Navigating Fox) and James Chambers (A Bright and Beautiful Eternal World).

title: Mo Welch
description: Comedian, cartoonist, and author Mo Welch (How to Die Alone: The Foolproof Guide to Not Helping Yourself) performs at Union Hall (Park Slope).

title: 46th Annual BRIC Celebrate Brooklyn! Festival: Meshell Ndegeocello
description: NYC’s longest-running, free, outdoor performing arts festival returns with concerts, films, dance, and more for 10 weeks. Tonight: Meshell Ndegeocello: No More Water: The Gospel of James Baldwin at Lena Horne Bandshell in Prospect Park (Brooklyn).
address: Lena Horne Bandshell, Prospect Park, Brooklyn

title: 2-for-1 Broadway Week Tickets
description: 2-for-1 broadway week tickets go on sale today: score broadway show tickets for less during this seasonal promotion! 2-for-1 tickets will go on sale today for performances September 3-15. 20+ productions are participating, including Hadestown, Hamilton, Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, Six, Stereophonic, The Book of Mormon, Water for Elephants, Wicked, and more.

title: Dancing Around the World’s Boro
description: As part of the annual Queensboro Dance Festival, Socrates Sculpture Park (LIC) hosts ‘Dancing Around the World’s Boro,’ a series of four open dance classes taught by a diverse range of Queens-based dance groups.

title: Jazz at Pier 84
description: The Jazz Foundation of America presents its annual series of outdoor evening concerts at Hell’s Kitchen’s Pier 84. The season closes with two performances: Dick Griffin Big Band (Tues, rescheduled from 7/17) and funk guitarist Debbie Knapper and the Knappertime Band (Weds).

title: Live at the Gantries
description: Kupferberg Center for the Arts presents Live at the Gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at Gantry Plaza State Park. Tonight: Luda Club (all-women salsa band).
